image.altText: A large crowd holding signs and waving jewsih flags work through a Melbourne street.

props.synopsis: In cities across the country, candles are being lit to mark one year since the Hamas terror attack on October 7, and the subsequent months of war in Gaza.Â

title.children: One year on from the October 7 attack, communities across Australia are pausing to remember those who have been lost

image.altText: Melissa and her sons seated and looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Australians who fled the conflict in Lebanon have touched down in Sydney on the first of two repatriation flights. Follow live.

title.children: Australians fleeing from Lebanon land in Sydney on first of two repatriation flights

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Israeli PM vows to bring back hostages
Australians fleeing Lebanon land in Sydney

image.altText: A headshot of a man in a suit.

props.synopsis: The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade says it "makes no apology" for Australia's views on Iran's strikes on Israel, after Iranian state reported the Australian ambassador had been summoned by Tehran.

title.children: 'Australia makes no apology': Government hits back after Australian ambassador summoned by Iran

image.altText: Two men pick up award on stage

props.synopsis: The winners for Medicine are selected by the Nobel Assembly of Sweden's Karolinska Institute medical university and receive a prize sum of $1.6 million.

title.children: US duo Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun win Nobel Prize in Medicine

image.altText: Nicola Gobbo has blonde hair and stares off screen.

props.synopsis: Lawyer X Nicola Gobbo has told a civil trial she thought she'd only have to be a police informer for a few weeks. Instead, she said, her life became like a spy novel.

title.children: 'How stupid was I?': Nicola Gobbo tells court about undercover missions and secret meetings

image.altText: Early morning sun shining through steam clouds billowing from a nuclear power plant and transmissions lines.

props.synopsis: As Australia considers the possibility of a nuclear-powered future, the US gives us insights into what does, and doesn't, work.

title.children: 'Clean power arsenal' or 'abject failure'?: What the US experience can tell Australia about nuclear power

image.altText: A blurry image of a boat sinking

props.synopsis: A Samoan man said oil from the sunk HMNZS Manawanui was identifiable along the coast for several kilometres which would have a "massive impact".

title.children: Fears of 'crazy' environmental impact after NZ naval ship sinks off Samoa's south

image.altText: FBI agents

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old planned a range of violent attacks including a school shooting, a bombing and poisoning of the water supply, a Melbourne court has heard.

title.children: Melbourne teenager flagged by FBI over alleged university bombing threat faces court

image.altText: A welcome to Australia balloon showing a koala and a kangaroo.

props.synopsis: There have been tears of joy and relief as hundreds of Australians evacuated from Lebanon touched down in Sydney on the first of two government-assisted repatriation flights.

title.children: Tears of joy and relief as hundreds of Australians fleeing conflict in Lebanon touch down in Sydney

image.altText: two men look down as the look through the wreckage of a city building

props.synopsis: In Beirut at night, you hear the constant low-level hum of Israeli drones. Sometimes, when it appears two or three drones hover over a target, the sound reaches a crescendo and a massive explosion often follows. Hezbollah is unable to shoot down any of these drones which present a round-the-clock threat.

title.children: The newest war in the Middle East is an asymmetric one â and Israel is winning

image.altText: A close up image of a man with blond hair in a suit.

props.synopsis: The Apprentice tells the story of Donald Trump and late mentor Roy Cohn as the former US president climbed to the top of the real estate ladder in 1980s New York City.

title.children: Donald Trump didn't want this film released before the US election â and it's been a lightning rod for controversy

image.altText: Kamala Harris sitting at a table with her hands folded, looking to her right.

props.synopsis: The US vice-president opened a media blitz by the Democratic ticket on Sunday by appearing on the Call Her Daddy podcast hosted by Alex Cooper.

title.children: 'It's really important for women to lift each other up': Kamala Harris rejects JD Vance 'childless cat ladies' dig in rare interview

image.altText: Two screens display texts sent by a scammer looking for a person named Anthony.

props.synopsis: Scammers are targeting Australians in offshore call centres as they're seen as "easy prey", according to a young migrant who used to work in an Ukrainian call centre.

title.children: Australians are being targeted by overseas scammers who see them as 'easy prey'

image.altText: Signage on the side of the Central Law Courts building in Perth during the daytime.

props.synopsis: A coroner rejects a bid by one of WA's highest ranking justice bosses to remove himself from an inquest into the state's first death in youth detention.

title.children: Coroner rejects bid by high-ranking justice boss to step down from youth detention death inquest

image.altText: Exterior of the District Court of Western Australia on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: A Kimberley man has been sentenced to five years behind bars after he distributed and possessed child abuse material. Police found more than 20,000 images of children being exploited on one of his devices.

title.children: Five year jail term for man who shared 'depraved' footage of children online

image.altText: Liam Martin of the Panthers with The Provan-Summons Trophy and the Clive Churchill medal for player of the match during the NRL Grand Final match between Panthers and Storm at the Accor Stadium on October 06, 2024 in Sydney, Australia.

props.synopsis: Liam Martin was giving up 12cm to Melbourne's aerial specialist Xavier Coates, but the Panthers backrower made the effort to take him on anyway, and it's this tenacity that propelled him to winning the Clive Churchill Medal.

title.children: The endless tenacity and unlikely aerial battle that won Liam Martin the Clive Churchill Medal

image.altText: Dan Houston of Port Adelaide celebrates with fans, walking around the ground shaking hands

props.synopsis: Gold Coast's number 13 draft pick could be the key that unlocks the Dan Houston AFL trade deal for Collingwood.

title.children: Houston and Smith dominate discussion on day one of AFL trade period â as it happened

image.altText: a rugby league team celebrates winning a grand final

props.synopsis: With the likes of Will Kennedy and Ben Barba on their side, Walgett was able to beat the equally star-studded Nanima Common Connection 46-12. On the women's side, the Redfern All Blacks avenged their 2023 grand final loss.

title.children: Walgett takes home back-to-back Koori Knockout titles with help from NRL stars

image.altText: A bald man concentrates while he scales a rock face

props.synopsis: Gus Taylor's long climb back after amputation and an accidental death.

title.children: 'It was a freak accident': How Gus Taylor learnt to forgive himself after his friend's death

image.altText: High density housing in suburban Sydney.

props.synopsis: Filling millions of spare bedrooms could help ease rental and cost of living pressures for vulnerable Australians in the short term, new research suggests.

title.children: Older Australians could rent out spare rooms to help ease the housing crisis, new research suggests

image.altText: flowers and a candles on a sidewalk. Police tape running through a peace sign made of metals.

props.synopsis: A post-mortem will confirm the identities of the bodies found after the Thorneside townhouse blaze.Â

title.children: Body believed to be missing babysitter found after blaze that also killed eight-year-old girl

image.altText: crisafulli speaking

props.synopsis: The LNP has unveiled its $590 million health plan, but Labor has accused the party of "handing in our homework". Doctor's groups say both parties have applied a "broad brush" to health policy.Â

title.children: LNP says its $590m health pitch is a 'comprehensive' cure. Labor says the party is 'handing in our homework'

image.altText: 32 Chunk stands in shallow waters as he looks off to his left

props.synopsis: Just four bears remain in contention for the title of beefiest bruin in this year's Fat Bear Week.Â

title.children: A Fat Bear Week rematch could be on the cards as heavyweights progress to finals

image.altText: John Pesutto appears serious, standing inside Parliament in front of a bookshelf.

props.synopsis: Pressure is mounting on the Victorian Liberal leader, with a group of MPs planning a leadership contest as the Moira Deeming defamation case looms over the party.

title.children: Victorian Liberal MPs planning to oust leader John Pesutto 'before Christmas'

image.altText: A young Christopher Ciccone and Madonna smile for photographers at a red carpet event

props.synopsis: Ciccone worked closely with his superstar sister as a dancer and creative, before releasing a tell-all book about his life with her in 2008.Â

title.children: Christopher Ciccone, Madonna's 'visionary' brother, dies aged 63

image.altText: A woman with grey hair sits in a chair in a house, looking out the window.

props.synopsis: Federal Financial Services Minister Stephen Jones says he wants to stamp out bad behaviour by retirement village operators following an ABC investigation that revealed "legalised financial abuse of the elderly" is rife.Â

title.children: Retirement villages put on notice after being accused of gouging older Australians in 'corporatised elder abuse'

image.altText: woman smiling wearing t-shirt in building with balloons background

props.synopsis: Rosanna Natoli says she's been cleared of any wrongdoing. A top integrity advocate has criticised the state's electoral commission for remaining silent about the complaint.

title.children: Queensland's electoral commission clears mayor after election donation investigation

image.altText: A man walking with cows.

props.synopsis: An increasing number of Chinese youths fed up with the pressures and values of urban life are moving to China's vast countryside and transforming it in their own ways.Â

title.children: 'People realise you don't have to work at a desk': China's young people are heading for the hills

image.altText: A small snail with a shell on its back with a swirl. It is sitting on a dark log.

props.synopsis: A critically endangered gastropod has caused two Queensland government projects, including the Nathan Dam development first proposed in the 1920s, to move at a snail's pace.

title.children: Snail brings billion-dollar dam, town's new footpath to a standstill

image.altText: Wine being put in a glass

props.synopsis: In the first visit by Chinese delegates since trade tariffs were lifted in April, West Australian wineries are showcasing their premium wines to big buyers in the hopes of landing lucrative contracts.

title.children: WA wineries plan to deal with China differently since tariffs lifted in April

image.altText: Jacquie Kelly hero image SINGLE USE ONLY DO NOT USE

props.synopsis: A Victorian landcare group has filed legal proceedings against the federal government, challenging the approval of artificial flooding as a "dodgy water offset project".

title.children: Community group launches legal action to protect Murray River flood plains in 'Kakadu of the south'

image.altText: A bishop in full robes.

props.synopsis: Melbourne-based Ukrainian bishop Mykola Bychok will become the first Australian-based cardinal since the death of George Pell. He was among 21 new cardinals announced by Pope Francis on Sunday in Rome.

title.children: Melbourne bishop chosen by Pope Francis to become a cardinal
